details.excerpt: This week was a relatively quiet week, with various members of the tech team being away for some portion of the week. Despite this quietness, it seemed to be a rather productive week, with lots of exciting projects in the pipeline.
details.content:
This week was a relatively quiet week, with various members of the tech team being away for some portion of the week. Despite this quietness, it seemed to be a rather productive week, with lots of exciting projects in the pipeline.

Ulrich was away on holiday until Wednesday, but spent lots of time preparing for delivering R training for Scottish Government statisticians, which is very exciting.

I worked a lot with James this week, continuing to get the moving parts of the gov.uk platform into place to demonstrate using the platform to publish our own content with our own look and feel.

In the later part of the week, James spent a bit of time with Sam on deploying the publishing platform into 'preduction' (not quite production, but a server that allows us demonstrate the platform to everyone), and spent even longer fixing failing tests.

Tom was away on Thursday and Friday, but in the first half of the week he did some prep for a talk from Max (one of our research interns, who also left us this week) about the research project he's been working on whilst at the ODI, and had a call with Quanta (one of our partners). He also attended the advisory board meeting of the EyeHub project (another one of our members).

Jeni prepared for and attended the Board meeting on Thursday, chatted to a couple of potential partners about localising the Open Data Certificates for other countries anddiscussed the local government projects who have won Breakthrough Fund funding. She alsoattended the first ODI member event, and worked on the National Information Infrastructure blog post as well as other policy development.
